intro: Mattiastrum turcicum, commonly known as Turkish thistle, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to southern Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and opposite leaf arrangement. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring gray-green, hairy leaves and purple to pink flower heads. It thrives in dry, sunny environments and is often found in grasslands and along roadsides. Mattiastrum turcicum is known for its medicinal properties, with historical use in traditional remedies for digestive and inflammatory conditions.
